title: COVID-GRAM Critical Illness Risk Score
description: Predicts risk of critical illness (ICU admission, mechanical ventilation, or death) in hospitalized COVID-19 patients

parameters.name: unconsciousness
parameters.description: Presence of unconsciousness or altered mental status

ranges.interpretation: Low probability of requiring ICU admission, mechanical ventilation, or death
Intermediate probability of requiring ICU admission, mechanical ventilation, or death
High probability of requiring ICU admission, mechanical ventilation, or death

references: Liang W, Liang H, Ou L, Chen B, Chen A, Li C, et al. Development and Validation of a Clinical Risk Score to Predict the Occurrence of Critical Illness in Hospitalized Patients With COVID-19. JAMA Intern Med. 2020;180(8):1081-1089. doi:10.1001/jamainternmed.2020.2033
formula: Risk Score = (X-ray abnormality × 27.1464) + (Age × 0.6139) + (Hemoptysis × 33.6210) + (Dyspnea × 14.0569) + (Unconsciousness × 34.4617) + (Number of comorbidities × 10.3826) + (Cancer history × 31.2211) + (Neutrophil-lymphocyte ratio × 1.25) + (LDH × 0.0534) + (Direct bilirubin × 3.0605). Risk = e^x / (1 + e^x)
notes: Developed from 1590 patients in development cohort and 710 in validation cohort from China
AUC of 0.88 (95% CI, 0.85-0.91) in development cohort
Critical illness defined as ICU admission, invasive mechanical ventilation, or death
Limited external validation - developed in Chinese population with specific characteristics
Requires multiple laboratory values including LDH and direct bilirubin
May not be directly applicable to all patient populations
Should be used in conjunction with clinical judgment
Developed during early pandemic period before widespread treatment advances
